newsitem.title: USA: CyberGuard stake cut by Tudor group.
newsitem.headline: CyberGuard stake cut by Tudor group.

text.p: A group led by Tudor Investment Corp, a New York based international management firm, said Tuesday it cut its stake in CyberGuard Corp to 337,600 common shares or 4.6 percent.

In a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission, the group said its latest transactions include a net 113,900 common sold between May 29, 1996 and March 12, 1997 at prices ranging from $9 to $20.25 per share.
CyberGuard is focused on the development and marketing of network security products. It was formerly known as Harris Computer Systems Corp.
